questions.question: What is 'OpenGL'?
options: Open Graphics Library (API for rendering 2D/3D vector graphics)
questions.correctAnswer: Open Graphics Library (API for rendering 2D/3D vector graphics)

questions.question: What is 'DirectX'?
options: A collection of APIs by Microsoft for handling multimedia tasks
questions.correctAnswer: A collection of APIs by Microsoft for handling multimedia tasks

questions.question: What is a 'Pixel'?
options: Smallest addressable element in an all points addressable display device
questions.correctAnswer: Smallest addressable element in an all points addressable display device

questions.question: What is 'RGB'?
questions.correctAnswer: Red Green Blue

questions.question: What is 'Vulkan'?
options: A low-overhead, cross-platform 3D graphics and computing API
questions.correctAnswer: A low-overhead, cross-platform 3D graphics and computing API

questions.question: What is a 'Vertex'?
options: A data structure that describes a point in space (position, color, etc.)
questions.correctAnswer: A data structure that describes a point in space (position, color, etc.)

questions.question: What is a 'Triangle' in 3D graphics?
options: The fundamental primitive used to render 3D models
questions.correctAnswer: The fundamental primitive used to render 3D models

questions.question: What is 'Rasterization'?
options: Taking an image described in a vector graphics format and converting it into a raster image (pixels)
questions.correctAnswer: Taking an image described in a vector graphics format and converting it into a raster image (pixels)

questions.question: What is 'Ray Tracing'?
options: A rendering technique for generating an image by tracing the path of light
questions.correctAnswer: A rendering technique for generating an image by tracing the path of light

questions.question: What is 'GPU'?
questions.correctAnswer: Graphics Processing Unit

questions.question: What is 'Shader'?
options: A type of computer program that was originally used to do shading
questions.correctAnswer: A type of computer program that was originally used to do shading

questions.question: What is 'GLSL'?
questions.correctAnswer: OpenGL Shading Language

questions.question: What is 'HLSL'?
questions.correctAnswer: High-Level Shading Language (DirectX)

questions.question: What is 'Texture Mapping'?
options: A method for defining high frequency detail, surface texture, or color information on a computer-generated graphic or 3D model
questions.correctAnswer: A method for defining high frequency detail, surface texture, or color information on a computer-generated graphic or 3D model

questions.question: What is 'UV Mapping'?
options: Process of projecting a 2D image to a 3D model's surface
questions.correctAnswer: Process of projecting a 2D image to a 3D model's surface

questions.question: What is 'Z-Buffering' (Depth Buffering)?
options: Management of image depth coordinates in 3D graphics
questions.correctAnswer: Management of image depth coordinates in 3D graphics

questions.question: What is 'Double Buffering'?
options: Using two buffers to hold data to prevent screen tearing/flickering
questions.correctAnswer: Using two buffers to hold data to prevent screen tearing/flickering

questions.question: What is 'VSync'?
options: Vertical Synchronization (syncing frame rate to monitor refresh rate)
questions.correctAnswer: Vertical Synchronization (syncing frame rate to monitor refresh rate)

questions.question: What is 'Antialiasing'?
options: Technique used to smooth jagged edges
questions.correctAnswer: Technique used to smooth jagged edges

questions.question: What is 'Ambient Occlusion'?
options: Shading method to approximate how exposed each point in a scene is to ambient lighting
questions.correctAnswer: Shading method to approximate how exposed each point in a scene is to ambient lighting

questions.question: What is 'Normal Mapping'?
options: Technique used for faking the lighting of bumps and dents
questions.correctAnswer: Technique used for faking the lighting of bumps and dents

questions.question: What is 'Phong Reflection Model'?
questions.correctAnswer: Empirical model of local illumination

questions.question: What is 'Frame Rate'?
options: Frequency at which consecutive images are called frames appear on a display
questions.correctAnswer: Frequency at which consecutive images are called frames appear on a display

questions.question: What is 'Projection Matrix'?
options: Matrix used to project 3D coordinates onto a 2D screen
questions.correctAnswer: Matrix used to project 3D coordinates onto a 2D screen

questions.question: What is 'Model Matrix'?
options: Transforms vertices from model space to world space
questions.correctAnswer: Transforms vertices from model space to world space

questions.question: What is 'Global Illumination'?
options: Algorithms used to add more realistic lighting (direct + indirect light)
questions.correctAnswer: Algorithms used to add more realistic lighting (direct + indirect light)

questions.question: What is 'WebGL'?
options: JavaScript API for rendering interactive 2D and 3D graphics within any compatible web browser
questions.correctAnswer: JavaScript API for rendering interactive 2D and 3D graphics within any compatible web browser

questions.question: What is 'Tessellation'?
options: Breaking a polygon into smaller polygons
questions.correctAnswer: Breaking a polygon into smaller polygons

questions.question: What is 'Compute Shader'?
options: Shader stage that is used for computing arbitrary information (not just graphics)
questions.correctAnswer: Shader stage that is used for computing arbitrary information (not just graphics)

questions.question: What is 'Deferred Shading'?
options: Shading is performed in a second pass on pixels, not vertices
questions.correctAnswer: Shading is performed in a second pass on pixels, not vertices

questions.question: What is 'Forward Rendering'?
options: Standard rendering where each object creates a draw call
questions.correctAnswer: Standard rendering where each object creates a draw call

questions.question: What is 'Bloom' effect?
options: Optical effect where light from a bright source appears to leak into surrounding objects
questions.correctAnswer: Optical effect where light from a bright source appears to leak into surrounding objects

questions.question: What is 'Frustum Culling'?
options: Removing objects that are not inside the view frustum (camera view)
questions.correctAnswer: Removing objects that are not inside the view frustum (camera view)

questions.question: What is 'Anisotropic Filtering'?
options: Method of enhancing the image quality of textures on surfaces that are at oblique viewing angles
questions.correctAnswer: Method of enhancing the image quality of textures on surfaces that are at oblique viewing angles

questions.question: What is 'PBR' (Physically Based Rendering)?
options: Method of shading/rendering that provides a more accurate representation of how light interacts with surfaces
questions.correctAnswer: Method of shading/rendering that provides a more accurate representation of how light interacts with surfaces

questions.question: What is 'BRDF'?
questions.correctAnswer: Bidirectional Reflectance Distribution Function

questions.question: What is 'Render Pipeline'?
options: Sequence of steps that OpenGL/DirectX takes to render an image
questions.correctAnswer: Sequence of steps that OpenGL/DirectX takes to render an image

questions.question: What is 'Draw Call Batching'?
options: Combining, or batching, multiple draw calls into one
questions.correctAnswer: Combining, or batching, multiple draw calls into one

questions.question: What is 'Instancing'?
options: Technique used to render multiple copies of the same mesh in a single draw call
questions.correctAnswer: Technique used to render multiple copies of the same mesh in a single draw call

questions.question: What is 'G-Buffer' (Geometry Buffer)?
options: Screen space representation of geometry and material information (used in deferred shading)
questions.correctAnswer: Screen space representation of geometry and material information (used in deferred shading)

questions.question: What is 'SSAO'?
questions.correctAnswer: Screen Space Ambient Occlusion

questions.question: What is 'HDR'?
questions.correctAnswer: High Dynamic Range

questions.question: What is 'Tone Mapping'?
options: Mapping one set of colors to another to approximate the appearance of high dynamic range images
questions.correctAnswer: Mapping one set of colors to another to approximate the appearance of high dynamic range images

questions.question: What is 'Quaternion'?
options: Number system used to represent rotations in 3D space
questions.correctAnswer: Number system used to represent rotations in 3D space

questions.question: What is 'Gimbal Lock'?
options: Loss of one degree of freedom in a three-dimensional, three-gimbal mechanism
questions.correctAnswer: Loss of one degree of freedom in a three-dimensional, three-gimbal mechanism

questions.question: What is 'Volumetric Lighting'?
options: Technique used to add lighting effects to a rendered scene (e.g., God rays)
questions.correctAnswer: Technique used to add lighting effects to a rendered scene (e.g., God rays)

questions.question: What is 'Parallax Mapping'?
options: Enhancement of normal mapping to provide more depth
questions.correctAnswer: Enhancement of normal mapping to provide more depth

questions.question: What is 'LOD'?
questions.correctAnswer: Level of Detail

questions.question: What is 'Depth of Field'?
options: Distance between the nearest and the farthest objects that are in acceptably sharp focus
questions.correctAnswer: Distance between the nearest and the farthest objects that are in acceptably sharp focus

questions.question: What is 'Motion Blur'?
options: Apparent streaking of moving objects in a photograph or a sequence of frames
questions.correctAnswer: Apparent streaking of moving objects in a photograph or a sequence of frames
